question: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us a partial skull at the Smithsonian Hall of Human Origins.)  Ouranopithecus macedoniensis, a 9-million-year-old ape from Greece, is a candidate as the long sought-for common ancestor of African apes & humans, popularly but inaccurately known by this two-word term
